news_header: Keir Starmer announced a £200m investment in Grangemouth, aiming to secure jobs and transition to clean energy.
news_original_title: PM announces £200m support fund for industrial site
news_text: Sir Keir Starmer has announced a £200m investment in the Grangemouth site, which is transitioning from an oil refinery to a low-carbon energy hub. The UK government aims to protect jobs and support a just transition for workers affected by the refinery's closure. The investment, part of the National Wealth Fund, is intended to attract private investment and develop new industries such as bioengineering and hydrogen energy. Scotland's first minister, John Swinney, also pledged £25m for a just transition fund. Unions have welcomed the funding but emphasize the need for detailed plans to ensure job security and effective use of the investment.
